newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nomura Sec says to announce president change.
newsitem.headline: Nomura Sec says to announce president change.

text.p: Nomura Securities Co Ltd said on Friday that it would hold a news conference at 11.30 a.m. (0230 GMT) on appointing a new president.

On Monday, two Nomura directors resigned after the brokerage firm said they made apparently illegal deals and funnelled funds to a corporate client that has been linked by Japanese media to a former "sokaiya" racketeer.

The Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission (SESC) has been investigating Nomura over the suspected illegal deals since last September and the probe is now centred on whether and how Nomura provided profits to a corporate customer, a securities industry source has told Reuters.

Major Japanese asset management firms, including Nomura unit Nomura Investment Management Co, and major Japanese trust banks have suspended business with Nomura since the brokerage disclosed the suspected illegal deals.
Many firms have said they will wait for the results of a probe by the SESC before resuming business with Nomura Securities.
